comments.author: @derpythecate6842
comments.text: Microwaves only work on polar molecules e.g H2O or CO2 close relative CO by causing them to rotate according to the frequency of the wave. It is this rotation that increase the kinetic energy of the molecules and hence cause the overall rise in temperature. However, CO2 has a linear structure and is non-polar due to the electronegativities of the two oxygen cancelling each other out. This means that it doesn't rotate with the microwave and heat up.
